definition: to compensate for loss/to indemnify/to suffer a financial loss
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)

sentences.english: Stiff reparations for war damages were to be paid—by the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 中國承擔嚴厲的戰爭賠款。

sentences.english: He also said the US, the biggest carbon emitter in history, did not owe reparations.
sentences.chinese: 他還說，歷史上最大的碳排放國美國不欠賠款。

sentences.english: If settlement currency option is not specified, HKD cheque will be issued.
sentences.chinese: 如沒有註明賠款貨幣，本公司將發出港幣支票。

sentences.english: Guo paid the judgment but refused to apologize or admit any wrongdoing.
sentences.chinese: 郭敬明支付了賠款但拒絕道歉或承認自己做錯了。

sentences.english: Apologies for government mistreatment and reparations have been rare in Congress.
sentences.chinese: 美國國會爲政府不公平待遇道歉甚至賠款相當罕見。

sentences.english: A few days later the club revoked the contract and refunded the advance.
sentences.chinese: 幾天後，這傢俱樂部違反了合同並且提前支付了賠款。

sentences.english: And all we known, both PRC and ROC gave up Japan, s war reparations.
sentences.chinese: 衆所周知，國共兩黨都免除了日本的戰爭賠款。

sentences.english: Qinghua by the United States returned to the auditorium is part of the Boxer Indemnity completed.
sentences.chinese: 清華大會堂是由美退還局部庚子賠款建成的。

sentences.english: Under this treaty, they were to pay an indemnity of 60 million pounds.
sentences.chinese: 根據這項條約，他們應賠款六千萬英鎊。

sentences.english: He collected on the damage to his house.
sentences.chinese: 他收到了房屋損壞的賠款。

sentences.english: Hillary Clinton won't be handing over a check for climate reparations.

sentences.english: The imperialist powers repeatedly forced the Qing government to cede territory and pay indemnities.

definition: to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
security measures (esp. border security)/official seal (esp. military seal during Qing and Ming times)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
variant of 巨額|巨额[ju4 e2]
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to get out of trouble/to escape from danger/a danger appears/threatened by danger
